column4: When I plug in my external hdd using USB port, what does it mount? What's the path ?
I can put that path to the /etc/apt/sources.list so I can use my external hdd for apt-get, yes ?
what does dpkg has to do with apt-get ?
dpkg is the program that installs and removes packages.  apt-get is the one for downloading them, but the it will use dpkg in the background
so if you already have the packages downloaded, you can use dpkg -i package.deb to manually install
oh, so the DVD has a repository of all sorts of packages on it?
but since you have a real repository with the right helper files, then apt-get will work
ya, one second...let me look it up
ok, you see the other entries in sources.list that start with "deb http://"?
yours should look like those, except with "file" instead of "http"
thanks man. I will try it now.
how can I open the file from the terminal in order to change it ?
you only want certain specific packages?
I need like 4 .. I was trying to install Alien earlier and I couldn't as I was missing some packages.
you could just hunt through the directories for the specific .debs
they should be in a "pool" directory somewhere, then sorted alphabetically
